◆ AM_HAL_SPOTMGR_INTERNAL_TIMER_NEEDED

#define AM_HAL_SPOTMGR_INTERNAL_TIMER_NEEDED   (0)

Macros to indicate whether Internal Timer is required by SPOT manager.

Macros to force all PCM version to be disabled when AM_HAL_DISABLE_SPOTMGR is defined

◆ DEVPWRST_ALL_PERIPH_MASK

#define DEVPWRST_ALL_PERIPH_MASK   0xFFFDE6FE

Defines.

Mask of all available peripherals for DEVPWRST, excluding SYSPLL

◆ DEVPWRST_BOOST_VDDC_PERIPH_MASK

#define DEVPWRST_BOOST_VDDC_PERIPH_MASK   0x3000061E

Mask of peripherals which need to boost VDDC only for DEVPWRST, including IOS, UART, IOM0/1/2/3.

◆ DEVPWRST_BOOST_VDDCF_PERIPH_MASK

#define DEVPWRST_BOOST_VDDCF_PERIPH_MASK   0xCFFDC0E0

Mask of peripherals which need to boost both VDDC and VDDF for DEVPWRST, including NETAOL, OTP, USBPHY/USB, SDIO, CRYPTO, DISP/DISPPHY, GFX, MSPI, I2S, PDM, I3C/I3CPHY, DBG, IOM4/5.

◆ DEVPWRST_MONITOR_PERIPH_MASK

#define DEVPWRST_MONITOR_PERIPH_MASK   DEVPWRST_ALL_PERIPH_MASK

Mask of DEV peripherals monitored by SPOT manager.

◆ DEVPWRST_MONITOR_PERIPH_MASK_PS1

#define DEVPWRST_MONITOR_PERIPH_MASK_PS1   DEVPWRST_BOOST_VDDCF_PERIPH_MASK

Mask of DEV peripherals monitored for power state 1.

◆ DEVPWRST_MONITOR_PERIPH_MASK_PS2

#define DEVPWRST_MONITOR_PERIPH_MASK_PS2   DEVPWRST_BOOST_VDDC_PERIPH_MASK

Mask of DEV peripherals monitored for power state 2.

enum am_hal_spotmgr_gpu_state_e

GPU status enum We never transition from LP to HP or vice versa - we always go to off first.

Enumerator
AM_HAL_SPOTMGR_GPUSTATE_OFF 
AM_HAL_SPOTMGR_GPUSTATE_ACTIVE 

◆ am_hal_spotmgr_stimulus_e

enum am_hal_spotmgr_stimulus_e

Stimulus for power state transition.

Enumerator
AM_HAL_SPOTMGR_STIM_CPU_STATE 

CPU power and performance state.

AM_HAL_SPOTMGR_STIM_GPU_STATE 

GPU power and performance state.

AM_HAL_SPOTMGR_STIM_TEMP 

Temperature range.

AM_HAL_SPOTMGR_STIM_DEVPWR 

Peripherals power state included in DEVPWRSTATUS regs, except GPU.

AM_HAL_SPOTMGR_STIM_AUDSSPWR 

Peripherals power state included in AUDSSPWRSTATUS regs.

AM_HAL_SPOTMGR_STIM_MEMPWR 

Memory power state included in MEMPWRSTATUS regs.

AM_HAL_SPOTMGR_STIM_SSRAMPWR 

SSRAM power state included in SSRAMPWRST regs.

AM_HAL_SPOTMGR_STIM_INIT_STATE 

Initialise MCU power state after SPOTMGR and SIMOBUCK are both initialised.

◆ am_hal_spotmgr_power_state_update()

uint32_t am_hal_spotmgr_power_state_update ( am_hal_spotmgr_stimulus_e eStimulus,
bool bOn,
void * pArgs )
extern

Power states update This API should be called before turning things on and after turning things off, or before switching to high performance mode and after switching to low power mode, or when temperature range is changed.

Parameters
eStimulus- Stimilus for power states transition. For GPU state/power changes, please use AM_HAL_SPOTMGR_STIM_GPU_STATE but not AM_HAL_SPOTMGR_STIM_DEVPWR.
bOn- Only needs to be set to true/false when turning on/off peripherals or memories included in DEVPWRSTATUS, AUDSSPWRSTATUS, MEMPWRSTATUS and SSRAMPWRST. It is ignored when updating temperature, CPU state and GPU state.
pArgs- Pointer to arguments for power states update, assign it to NULL if not needed.

When eStimulus is AM_HAL_SPOTMGR_STIM_CPU_STATE, bOn is ignored, and pArgs must point to a am_hal_spotmgr_cpu_state_e enum.

When eStimulus is AM_HAL_SPOTMGR_STIM_GPU_STATE, bOn is ignored, and pArgs must point to a am_hal_spotmgr_gpu_state_e enum.

When eStimulus is AM_HAL_SPOTMGR_STIM_TEMP, bOn is ignored, and pArgs must point to a am_hal_spotmgr_tempco_param_t struct.

When eStimulus is AM_HAL_SPOTMGR_STIM_DEVPWR, bOn must be set to true when turning on a peripheral, bOn must be set to false when turning off a peripheral, and pArgs must point to the DEVPWRSTATUS_MASK of the peripheral to be opened when turning on a peripheral, pArgs is ignored when turning off a peripheral.

When eStimulus is AM_HAL_SPOTMGR_STIM_AUDSSPWR, bOn must be set to true when turning on a peripheral, bOn must be set to false when turning off a peripheral, and pArgs must point to the AUDSSPWRSTATUS_MASK of the peripheral to be opened when turning on a peripheral, pArgs is ignored when turning off a peripheral.

When eStimulus is AM_HAL_SPOTMGR_STIM_MEMPWR, bOn is ignored, and pArgs must point to the entire MEMPWRSTATUS.

When eStimulus is AM_HAL_SPOTMGR_STIM_SSRAMPWR, bOn must be set to true when turning on partial or entire SSRAM, bOn must be set to false when turning off partial or entire SSRAM, and pArgs must point to the expected SSRAMPWRST when turning on, pArgs is ignored when turning off.

Returns
SUCCESS or other Failures.

◆ g_sSpotMgrINFO1regs

am_hal_spotmgr_info1_regs_t g_sSpotMgrINFO1regs
extern
